intro: Carludovica mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces striking violet or purple flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in the humid, tropical conditions of its native habitat. The plant is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes.
